headline: Stuffed Cream Cheese Mushrooms
description: Stuffed mushrooms with cream cheese are a party favorite. This classic appetizer features oven-baked caps filled with a creamy, garlicky filling.

video.description: Perfect appetizer to make that‚Äôs simple and delicious! Savory and creamy stuffed mushrooms!
video.name: Stuffed Cream Cheese Mushrooms

name: Stuffed Cream Cheese Mushrooms
recipeIngredient: 12 whole fresh mushrooms, tough ends trimmed

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Prepare a baking sheet with cooking spray.
Clean mushrooms with a damp paper towel. Carefully break stems from mushrooms. Finely chop stems and set caps aside.

Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Fry chopped mushroom stems and garlic in hot oil until any moisture has disappeared, taking care not to burn the garlic, 3 to 5 minutes. Spread mushroom mixture into a bowl to cool completely, about 10 minutes.

Stir cream cheese, Parmesan cheese, black pepper, onion powder, and cayenne pepper into the cooled mushroom mixture until very thick and completely mixed. Use a small spoon to fill each mushroom cap with a generous amount of stuffing. Arrange stuffed mushrooms on the prepared cookie sheet.
Bake in the preheated oven until piping hot and liquid starts to form under each cap, about 20 minutes.

review.reviewBody: I tweaked it a bit. added red onions, fake crab meat, left out the onion powder. Was delicious!
These are deliscious, I'm obsessed with them. I added some finely chopped spinach and green onions. And easy to make.
Easy and deeeee-lish.

I used a little bit less cream cheese then ordered and it was the perfect fix to have the right amount in my mushrooms as before I‚Äôve been left with too much filling. Delicious!! Picture is from before hitting the oven.
This was my third time making it. This recipe is sooo good and easy to make. Great appetizer or side dish. Luv it!

We loved this with a twist! I tried this a while ago and it turned out great but it had a bit more spice than my family likes. I instead did onion powder and paprika. Because they roll around when moving the cookie sheet, we put them in mini muffin tin and it held them upright and they turned out perfect!
Delicious! Added bacon bits to the creamy mixture and grilled instead of baked. Awesome!
I added bacon bits and garnished with finely chopped green onions. Absolutely delicious! (Warn those who want one immediately that it will burn their mouths if not allowed to cool a little!) üòÅ
Great recipe real easy to do. Enjoyed it and very tasty!
Excellent
Easy & delicious! Will definitely be a keeper.

For my family it was a bit to much garlic for us. 2nd time used half as much garlic & added a "handful" of finely graded cheddar cheese and then for my group it was perfect. Will make again and again.

These were very good. I tasted the cream cheese mixture before stuffing the mushroom caps. It wasn't flavorful enough for me, so I kept adding the spices until I liked it. After filling the mushroom caps, I added some shredded parmesan on top. I cooked these in my air fryer at 350 degrees for 6 minutes. Delicious!

I made these tonight but, instead of the added garlic with the stems. I threw in panko bread crumbs...I used garden vegetable cream cheese and added shredded mozzarella and a pinch of cayenne pepper on top. They were delicious! I did try the garlic at first but, I didn't like the taste. I may have added too much garlic though because normally I love garlic but, I really liked it with the panko.
Good but a little too spicy. Use less cayenne pepper.
Everyone loved this. I used extra ground black pepper.

These mushrooms are delicious and easy to make. I used Boursin cheese for the stuffing mix. I didn‚Äôt want to throw out the stems so I chopped them small, cooked them and added them to the stuffing mix. I didn‚Äôt have any Panko bread so I used crushed Pepperidge Farm seasoned stuffing with the grated Parmesan cheese. Rave reviews at the cocktail party.
Awesome! Super easy!

No need to look anywhere else this is the best stuffed cream cheese mushrooms on the net.
Wow, was I ever impressed!
I added more parmesan than called for, quite a bit actually. This turned out FABULOUS!

If you really want these mushrooms to pop, place them on a broiler pan and smoke them! Smoke them at 180 degrees for 30 minutes and then increase the heat to 350 degrees for another 30 minutes. Some of the moisture will evaporate and you will have chewy greatness. Also, the slight crust along the stuffing will make you eat these over and over again!!!
Best recipe ever. You can tweak to suite your taste. I took the advice of many reviews and placed them on a rack. Also broiled at the end of cooking. Best base recipe; thank you so much Lindsay
Delicious. I added a little seasoning salt.

Followed the recipe...however, I used 
Tillamook Aged Cheddar Cream Cheese, Yum!!! They turned out great!
Yummy mushrooms. I made a smaller amount (for one) and used them as part of an appy tray. Thanks for sharing this nice keeper.
Loved the simplicity and the kick from the cayenne. I used home grown mushrooms and added a T of chopped garlic chives. I also sprinkled shredded parm on top.

Super simple to prepare! I changed it up a little bit and added some chopped spinach and 1/4 teaspoon of rosemary. Turned out very delicious, whole family loved them ( including the dog who snuck one)! Would definitely recommend this recipe!(:
Tastes great! I only used half of the cream cheese and it was more than enough!
Made these as a side dish, went over better than the Meal itself, everyone loved them, will makes these again
Super easy and delicious!
I served these at a small get together to RAVE reviews! Cant wait to make them again. YUMMMMM
Outstanding! I added fresh basil, rosemary, thyme and parsley. Used a melon ball scooper to put mixture onto mushroom cap then rolled into toasted panko crumbs. Delicious! Thank you for the recipe!
too much cream cheese - tastes like eating cream cheese blocks with a hint of mushroom

I wanted to give this recipe 5 stars but mine didn't turn out quite like the ones pictured. I could be because I used garden vegetable cream cheese instead of plain. Also my mushrooms were a little on the small side. I'm going to try it again when I have the right ingredients. The taste was delicious and everyone liked them.
I skipped the cayenne, topped with freshly grated parm, delicious!
The mushrooms came out perfectly. Served them for super bowl. Should have made a double batch. They disappeared before I could get a second one.
Amazing! The family loved these and then I made them for the crew at the firehouse. It was a huge hit!!

These were easy to make and they were creamy and tasty.
I made them for a family party and everyone enjoyed.

I made it as written and the flavor is delicious. a bit spicy so be aware of the kick. I'll make this again but might try substituting paprika for the Cayenne for a more smokey flavor. the reason I gave this 4 stars instead of five is because the filling makes a lot more than will fit into 12 mushroom caps. I ended up using every mushroom in the 16 oz container which made 32 mushrooms and still had filling leftover. I might try halving the cream cheese and seasonings next time. will def make again

These were fabulous!!! I somehow forgot to put the sauteed mushroom stems with garlic into the cream cheese mixture (realized after mushrooms were stuffed and was short on time). I sprinkled them over the cream cheese, and despite my mistake the pkatter was still empty. Thank you for a great recipe!!
I added bread crumbs to mixture also. Everyone loved them.
Excellent base. I used smokey chipotle to increase the heat slightly.
Delicious and so easy!! This is a great quick appetizer or side dish for guests and holidays. Very flavorful and one of those recipes you can just eyeball all the ingredients to taste.

I am NOT known for making delicious meals. Seriously. But these were the absolute best stuffed mushrooms I've ever made... maybe even the best appetizer I've ever made. (Thank you Lindsay!!) I followed the recipe except I forgot the onion powder, I used 5 oz of cream cheese, and I crushed up one strip of bacon and sprinkled a pinch on the bottom of the cup before filling with cheese mixture, and another pinch on top of the cheese mixture. Also, I took someone else's advice and piped the cheese into each cap to pack it in. I baked for 10 minutes, and broiled on hi for 6 minutes. Perfectly done. Yum!!! I can't wait to make this again.
If you like mushrooms, then you will love this recipe. There is never any left-overs after the party.

Made these for the first time, and they are phenomenal! Definitely going to be making these again. Only thing I did different from the recipe was sprinkle some shredded parmesan cheese on top before baking. I also filled some baby bellas which came out quite nice!
These are delicious, you don‚Äôt need the pam spray, and I add real bacon bits too.

This was a favorite of the whole family's Thanksgiving dinner. It was eaten really fast. What I did was I combined this recipe with the Bacon wrapped stuffed mushroom and tada!! First thing gone on the table.

Thank you for this recipe
Absolutely delicious !!!

These are so delicious.
No changes needed!
??
I used lobster rather than stems
Cooked just as written. Delicious! For the grandkids, I‚Äôll cut back on the cayenne. But these were perfect for me and the hubs. These are going in the rotation!!
I loved this recipe! I will definitely make it again but I may cut the amount of cream cheese I put in.
perfect to snack on

Excellent mushrooms. I added a splash of white wine to the mushroom stems and garlic saute. I melted the cream cheese into the pan with the saute. I then added a generous pinch of both shredded mozzarella and cheddar, then stuffed the shrooms. I did not add cayenne.
A definite hit!
Turned out great! I added a bit more garlic.

Saut√© onion or scallion and then garlic cloves in butter along with the stems - also chopped spinach, roasted or chopped red pepper... Add some bacon, sausage, crab, prosciutto or pepperoni bits. Or change the cheese to cheddar and add chopped crab meat. Add a few drops of sriracha/hot sauce for extra spice. For more colour: maybe chives, paprika or parsley on top. Cut the corner off a Ziploc bag and squeeze filling into caps. Panko on top plus shredded Parm for extra kick. Bake on a broiler pan so they don't sit in juice - less soggy and less mess.

These were great. I did not make any changes. My husband also loved them, although he SAID they were so rich he could only eat one. I noticed, though, that later he was eating two at a time. I will be making these for guests in the future.
I doubled the recipe an wow it was a hit, the mushrooms were gone as soon as I placed them on the table an people were asking for more, recipe was easy to follow, thank you for posting
They are out of this world !
This is a keeper. Easy and delicious
I love these!!!! I also stuffed some with pork sausage mixed with the cream cheese. Very moist and delicious
I did not cook the mushrooms or the garlic. Everyone went crazy for them.
Easy to make and got great reviews from my guests!
These were inhaled by my family! I did as others suggested: put mushrooms on a rack with a foil-lined sturdy sheet pan underneath.

These were delicious. I used herb and garlic cream cheese, and sprinkled a bit of Italian bread crumbs on top. Serve three of us with big mushroom caps, wish I had more at the time. So YUMMY!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Amazing! But I didn‚Äôt have cayenne pepper and onion powder so I made adjustments. I added crushed red peppers - just a touch. And chopped two green onions. It was amazing! I will make this again for certain.

I made this for a meal with my parents, therefore I did omit the Cayenne. When I make again, which I will absolutely do, I look forward to the Cayenne added back in. As I expected the flavor to be dim, due to the Cayenne omission, I added in about an 1/4 cup of minced cooked bacon. Yes, Bacon makes everything better:)
This is an exceptional appetizer! I kept hearing make more...make it again!!!
When I make these, I always add precooked bacon and grated smoked Gouda. It‚Äôs delicious!!

Great recipe and I have had a few times. Decided to try on my own. I made a few changes, saut√©ed a Jimmy Dean sausage roll and chopped up and cooled completely as step one, to be added to the mix before putting in the mushrooms. Also, used fresh grated Parmesan versus the dry bottled stuff. Lastly, I love when these are super creamy, so instead of regular bar Philly Cream Cheese I used the 8 oz. whipped container. They were AMAZING and due to the added ingredients made about 20 mushrooms versus 14.
I made these mushrooms for our Thanksgiving appetizer. My guests and I love them. This recipe will be used again when company comes. It's so easy!
i've made these more times than i can count by now. be sure to serve them right out of the oven. they cool very quickly.
I added a bag of croutons, onions & thinly chopped bell peppers & worshire sauce. Put a layer of Swiss cheese on top. It was awesome.
This was my first attempt at preparing stuffed mushrooms and they were wonderful. I added a fresh jalape√±o and bacon to the stuffing. I will definitely be making these again!
Awesome!!! Made exactly to recipe and had enough filling for 2 containers of mushrooms. Definitely a hit!
Simple and a great appetizer.

I was looking for a keto friendly recipe and this fit the bill. I had a big container of baby portobellos to use and the amount of cream cheese mixture was perfect. I used cheddar, mozzarella and parmesan. I also poured some dry red wine over the tops and so they were sitting in a little bit of wine. They soaked up the flavor. I broiled them for about five minutes at the end and the top had a nice crunch without the use of breadcrumbs. These were dinner along with a salad. The leftovers heated up nicely in the microwave for lunch the next day. I could eat them daily!

Easy on the barbecue! I followed the recipe pretty closely, just added a bit of finely chopped red pepper to the mushroom tops and garlic when I was frying those up. Then popped them on the upper shelf on the barbecue as it was heating - The mushroom caps were perfectly cooked when my delicious marinated salmon was done - maybe 20 mins with BBQ temp fluctuating between 325 and 375.

Made this 2 ways... 
I added cooked strips of bacon in the bottom of the mushrooms. - Amazing

And I ended up with extra cream cheese mixture so I took left over bacon strips and smeared their length with the cream cheese mix and then rolled them up like sushi rolls. OMG- even more amazing than the mushrooms!!!
Fantastic and easy! I did add finely chopped red pepper and green onion. I would try this next time with some crab for variation
Made exactly as directed. Quick, easy, and delicious.

These are delicious! The cream cheese is a perfect match for the mushrooms. I used a four cheese blend instead of just parmesan. It had provolone, asiago, romano, and Parmesan cheese. I will definitely be making these again!
These were simple and delicious! A definite keeper~YUM!!! Thanks for sharing. :)
Definitely a 5 star in this family... I did add bacon and chives in it.. it was a big hit!!
They were delicious. Saving this recipe!
More mix than mushrooms. I'd prefer to thin out the cream cheese with more mushroom and breadcrumbs. Very tasty.

I liked these 3 stars, but since everyone else at Christmas dinner really loved them I gave them 4 stars. I didn't make any changes. Personally, I thought they tasted too cream cheesy. They were very garlicky also which I liked, but just felt they are missing something.
Made the first time as directed. Plate totally wiped out! Tons of compliments! Really good recipe. Thanks for sharing!

I make these around the holidays and they are always a hit! I add seasoned breadcrumbs on top and spray it with a little olive oil spray or a drizzle of olive oil before baking. To save time, I prep them the night before and store in a flat air tight container. Enjoy!!!

Very good appetizer. Good for people with gluten issues.
I've made a few times and use whatever cheeses are on hand. Everything works. You'll get lots of compliments.
Hi. No changes and everyone has loved it every time I take it to a party. Sometimes I butter the mushroom buttons on the outside.
Made it for Thanksgiving absolutely none left! Appetizer hit of the day!!!
Easy and delicious! I topped and baked them with Frenchs Fried Onions andkept everything else the same.
My family demands I make these every time we all get together. Definitely a favorite. I skip the cayenne pepper just because we aren't fans of spicy. Love this recipe!

This is a super easy base for stuffed mushrooms.I have made this with smoky bacon,sausage,crab,and prosciutto or pepperoni bits.Veggies I have used,sateed chopped spinach added roasted or chopped red pepper,carmeluzed onion scallion.Any left overs works great as a stuffing for pounded chicken or turkey breast even on top of burgers.They always disappear.

I liked the simplicity of this recipe. Unlike other stuffed mushroom recipes with spinach, peppers, crab..., this one delivers a clean mushroom taste with a hint of garlic.
The amount of the cream cheese sounded like alot for 12 mushrooms ( mine were medium size)
So I cut it by half and I had plenty of stuffing for all the mushrooms.
My Mushrooms were little watery though, maybe next time,raising the oven temperature little bit, would prevent that.
So yummy! I made it exactly as written but also added a little square of sliced swiss cheese on top of each mushroom before it went in the oven. Everyone loved it!
